intro: Baeria leptalea, commonly known as the slender leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and elongated, giving it its common name. The flowers are usually blue or violet, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
